Articles.Content:
Imagine if you could take a fuel tank, and then clip some other part partially inside it, and the game would reduce the usable volume of the fuel tank based on volume of the part that was clipped into it.  Would this even be worthwhile? 

Edited December 31, 2020 by eberkain

Somehow not... i think, it wouldn't be worth the effort... it would drasticly complicate making aestetic vehicles using part clipping. I often clip parts, caps, plates and stuff to make nice optical impressions, as the amount of parts to pick and choose from is very limited

Edited January 1, 2021 by Rakete

On 12/31/2020 at 4:01 PM, eberkain said:

Imagine if you could take a fuel tank

I'd rather have proper structural parts.

I'd like that. I'm one of those players who never uses part-clipping, but sometimes it would be very useful to do so.

 

I wonder how easy it is to code? You could just add it to the settings, toggle on/off.

On 12/31/2020 at 2:01 PM, eberkain said:

Imagine if you could take a fuel tank, and then clip some other part partially inside it, and the game would reduce the usable volume of the fuel tank based on volume of the part that was clipped into it.  Would this even be worthwhile? 

Would be fantastic if this could be, would mostly eliminate my aversion to part clipping.
